answers.answer: Many times this is caused by a chromosome problem in the baby.  Infection, diabetes, the mother being a smoker can also lead to miscarriage.  The doctors might be able to determine why this is happening but there is a good chance they won't be able to.  If it were me, I would try to go on bed rest as soon as I thought I might be pregnant.  It's possible that if your body can focus more on the baby and less on you, that the chance of miscarriage would be less.  Also, if you smoke or have uncontrolled diabetes, etc., try to take care of those issues now before becoming pregnant again.
